definitions.definition: having the very darkest colour, like coal or the sky at night

examples.text: a shiny black car
black storm clouds
She had curly black hair and hazel eyes.
a black night
My head banged on a rock and everything went black.
The wind and rain intensified the black darkness outside.
Through the black night came the sound of thunder.

definitions.definition: belonging to a group of people who have dark skin, especially people who come from or whose ancestors came from Africa; connected with black people

examples.text: The film is set in a historically black community.
a discussion of what it means to be Black and British
a Black woman writer
He's seen as a role model for young Black men.
Two black coffees, please.
chimneys black with smoke
Go and wash your hands; they're absolutely black!
She's been in a really black mood all day.
Rory shot her a black look.
The future looks pretty black.
It's been another black day for the north-east with the announcement of further job losses.
black deeds/lies

definitions.definition: dealing with unpleasant or terrible things, such as murder, in a humorous way

examples.text: ‘Good place to bury the bodies,’ she joked with **black humour**.
The play is a **black comedy**.

definitions.definition: (to hit somebody until they are) covered with bruises (= blue, brown or purple marks on the body)
used to say that you should not criticize somebody for a fault that you have yourself

wordOrigin: Old English blæc, of Germanic origin.
